fields.description:
Tested on FF/MAC, console installed on CentOS from packages.

Steps to reproduce: 
1) go to user detail page
2) Click Add access policy button

This results in an unresponsive script error. Screenshots included. 

Error seen in javascript console in angular.min.js (line 103)

fields.summary: Going to IAM user "Add Access Policy" dialog throws javascript error

comments.body: [~alice]: The $rootScope:inprog error is a known issue and has been there for a while (it also affects 4.1 IIRC) and has no impact on the functionality of the page.  The JS console error has nothing to do with the unresponsive script error, which displays when firebug or web inspector is open when loading the IAM policy wizard (due to the large number of DOM elements on that page).  Could you test if the page displays an unresponsive script dialog when Firebug is *not* open?
[~kgill] I just  reproduced the error without the firebug running. Trying to add access policy to user00/ui-test-acct-00 triggers javascript error on http://10.111.5.1 I am attaching a screenshot.
[~alice]: What happens when you click the "Continue" button in the dialog?
[~kgill] When I click the "Continue" button the error message disappears. Feel free to log in to https://10.111.5.1 shared test cloud to reproduce.
I discovered this bug using 4.1.2 as well.
[~ccassler] does the same workaround exist for 4.1.2?
This bug is causing firefox to crash when using the Selenium IDE under Linux.  I cannot use the selenium IDE when running these tests.
In 4.1.2 eucaconsole with FF/linux that is run without Selenium IDE or Firebug open we don't see the bug.

The Policy Generator is much faster now and doesn't generate the "stop script" dialog on Firefox.

PR is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1464

Note to QA: Although it doesn't affect the functionality of the IAM Policy Generator, we're stuck with the "$rootScope.inprog" errors in the JS console for now since those are due to interactions between Angular and the other libraries used on that page (jQuery, etc.).
FF page loads in 5-6 seconds now. Better! No stop script seen. UX review passed, ready for code review.
Seems to be up to 2 times faster to load (based on non-exacting measurements)

Verified.  I was not able to reproduce this.
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.1                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.6851.457.20150713git5ecf6d2.el6   Build Date: Mon 13 Jul 2015 11:59:44 AM PDT
Install Date: Mon 13 Jul 2015 01:32:31 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-198
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6851.457.20150713git5ecf6d2.el6.src.rpm

{code}
